Hershey Friedman is a Canadian billionaire businessman and philanthropist known for his ventures in plastics packaging, kosher meat, luxury real estate, and Jewish book publishing. He expanded his family's textile business into a major plastics packaging company, supplying brands like Hershey’s and Pepsi, and acquired Agri Star Meat, a kosher meat producer, while developing luxury real estate in Israel. A significant philanthropist, he funds large-scale projects like the "Friedman edition" of Jewish texts, including the Babylonian Talmud, and provided humanitarian aid during the 2023 Israel conflict. Friedman also maintains a dual residence in Montreal and Israel, with family members involved in his business operations.

# Hershey Friedman



**Hershey Friedman** (born 1950) is a Canadian billionaire businessman and philanthropist. [S2] His business concerns span the plastics packaging business and kosher meat in North America as well as luxury real estate development and Jewish books in Israel. [S3] ## Early life

Hershey Friedman was born in 1950 in Montreal, Quebec. [S4] His parents, Yisroel D. [S5] and Elza Friedman, owned a textile company. [S6] His father was paralysed in a car accident in 1960, when Friedman was ten years old. [S7] He has two brothers. [S8] Friedman was raised as an Orthodox Jew. [S9] He attended Yeshivas Ner Yisroel near Baltimore and Beit Shraga in Monsey, New York. [S10] He later studied law and accounting in Montreal. [S11] ## Career

Friedman started his career by working for his family textile company. [S12] By 1982, he acquired a plastics packaging business. [S13] By 2014, Friedman told *The Jerusalem Post*, "we are the largest in North America, packaging Hershey’s chocolates, Pepsi, Nestle, Elle Candy, the famous Entenmann’s donuts, McCain’s fries, as well as larger and smaller companies internationally and locally. [S14] We’re also probably the largest bread-bag producer."

Friedman purchased Azorim, a real estate development company which builds luxury apartments in Israel, from Shaya Boymelgreen in 2009-2011. [S15] The company built the Beeri-Nehardea Tower; it also planned to build the Elite Tower, but the project was discontinued. [S16] Friedman purchased Agriprocessors, a kosher meat company based in Iowa, USA in 2009. [S17] Shortly after, he renamed it Agri Star Meat and Poultry. [S18] All employees are E-Verified. [S19] Friedman is the co-owner of "Dun & Bradstreet, Fourier, which produces solutions for scientific education, and CVD, a development company."

Friedman is a billionaire. [S20] ## Philanthropy

Friedman is a philanthropist who contributes to charities, hospitals and yeshivas. [S21] He also invests heavily in funding large-scale projects of publishing holy *seforim* and is the chief patron of the Babylonian Talmud (Vilna Edition Shas), the Jerusalem Talmud, Shulchan Aruch and Mishna Berura published by the Oz Vehadar institute. [S22] These editions are called 'Friedman edition'. [S23] The cost of the Babylonian Talmud project was over $20 million. [S24] In 2023, Friedman continued his legacy of philanthropy by offering fully furnished apartments through his real estate company Azorim to evacuees of the conflict in southern Israel, free of charge. [S25] His Agri Star meat business also facilitated shipments of kosher, shelf-stable food to soldiers on the front lines. [S26] These actions reflect his commitment to both humanitarian aid and Jewish communal support. [S27] ## Personal life

Friedman is married to Raisy Stuhl since 1975. [S28] They have six married children, all of whom work for his businesses. [S29] Friedman resides in Montreal. [S30] He spends one week every month in Israel.

# Hershey Friedman



**Hershey Friedman** (born 1950) is a Canadian billionaire businessman and philanthropist. [S2] His business concerns span the plastics packaging business and kosher meat in North America as well as luxury real estate development and Jewish books in Israel. [S3] ## Early life

Hershey Friedman was born in 1950 in Montreal, Quebec. [S4] His parents, Yisroel D. [S5] and Elza Friedman, owned a textile company. [S6] His father was paralysed in a car accident in 1960, when Friedman was ten years old. [S7] He has two brothers. [S8] Friedman was raised as an Orthodox Jew. [S9] He attended Yeshivas Ner Yisroel near Baltimore and Beit Shraga in Monsey, New York. [S10] He later studied law and accounting in Montreal. [S11] ## Career

Friedman started his career by working for his family textile company. [S12] By 1982, he acquired a plastics packaging business. [S13] By 2014, Friedman told *The Jerusalem Post*, "we are the largest in North America, packaging Hershey’s chocolates, Pepsi, Nestle, Elle Candy, the famous Entenmann’s donuts, McCain’s fries, as well as larger and smaller companies internationally and locally. [S14] We’re also probably the largest bread-bag producer."

Friedman purchased Azorim, a real estate development company which builds luxury apartments in Israel, from Shaya Boymelgreen in 2009-2011. [S15] The company built the Beeri-Nehardea Tower; it also planned to build the Elite Tower, but the project was discontinued. [S16] Friedman purchased Agriprocessors, a kosher meat company based in Iowa, USA in 2009. [S17] Shortly after, he renamed it Agri Star Meat and Poultry. [S18] All employees are E-Verified. [S19] Friedman is the co-owner of "Dun & Bradstreet, Fourier, which produces solutions for scientific education, and CVD, a development company."

Friedman is a billionaire. [S20] ## Philanthropy

Friedman is a philanthropist who contributes to charities, hospitals and yeshivas. [S21] He also invests heavily in funding large-scale projects of publishing holy *seforim* and is the chief patron of the Babylonian Talmud (Vilna Edition Shas), the Jerusalem Talmud, Shulchan Aruch and Mishna Berura published by the Oz Vehadar institute. [S22] These editions are called 'Friedman edition'. [S23] The cost of the Babylonian Talmud project was over $20 million. [S24] In 2023, Friedman continued his legacy of philanthropy by offering fully furnished apartments through his real estate company Azorim to evacuees of the conflict in southern Israel, free of charge. [S25] His Agri Star meat business also facilitated shipments of kosher, shelf-stable food to soldiers on the front lines. [S26] These actions reflect his commitment to both humanitarian aid and Jewish communal support. [S27] ## Personal life

Friedman is married to Raisy Stuhl since 1975. [S28] They have six married children, all of whom work for his businesses. [S29] Friedman resides in Montreal. [S30] He spends one week every month in Israel.

# Hershey Friedman



**Hershey Friedman** (born 1950) is a Canadian billionaire businessman and philanthropist. [S2] His business concerns span the plastics packaging business and kosher meat in North America as well as luxury real estate development and Jewish books in Israel. [S3] ## Early life

Hershey Friedman was born in 1950 in Montreal, Quebec. [S4] His parents, Yisroel D. [S5] and Elza Friedman, owned a textile company. [S6] His father was paralysed in a car accident in 1960, when Friedman was ten years old. [S7] He has two brothers. [S8] Friedman was raised as an Orthodox Jew. [S9] He attended Yeshivas Ner Yisroel near Baltimore and Beit Shraga in Monsey, New York. [S10] He later studied law and accounting in Montreal. [S11] ## Career

Friedman started his career by working for his family textile company. [S12] By 1982, he acquired a plastics packaging business. [S13] By 2014, Friedman told *The Jerusalem Post*, "we are the largest in North America, packaging Hershey’s chocolates, Pepsi, Nestle, Elle Candy, the famous Entenmann’s donuts, McCain’s fries, as well as larger and smaller companies internationally and locally. [S14] We’re also probably the largest bread-bag producer."

Friedman purchased Azorim, a real estate development company which builds luxury apartments in Israel, from Shaya Boymelgreen in 2009-2011. [S15] The company built the Beeri-Nehardea Tower; it also planned to build the Elite Tower, but the project was discontinued. [S16] Friedman purchased Agriprocessors, a kosher meat company based in Iowa, USA in 2009. [S17] Shortly after, he renamed it Agri Star Meat and Poultry. [S18] All employees are E-Verified. [S19] Friedman is the co-owner of "Dun & Bradstreet, Fourier, which produces solutions for scientific education, and CVD, a development company."

Friedman is a billionaire. [S20] ## Philanthropy

Friedman is a philanthropist who contributes to charities, hospitals and yeshivas. [S21] He also invests heavily in funding large-scale projects of publishing holy *seforim* and is the chief patron of the Babylonian Talmud (Vilna Edition Shas), the Jerusalem Talmud, Shulchan Aruch and Mishna Berura published by the Oz Vehadar institute. [S22] These editions are called 'Friedman edition'. [S23] The cost of the Babylonian Talmud project was over $20 million. [S24] In 2023, Friedman continued his legacy of philanthropy by offering fully furnished apartments through his real estate company Azorim to evacuees of the conflict in southern Israel, free of charge. [S25] His Agri Star meat business also facilitated shipments of kosher, shelf-stable food to soldiers on the front lines. [S26] These actions reflect his commitment to both humanitarian aid and Jewish communal support. [S27] ## Personal life

Friedman is married to Raisy Stuhl since 1975. [S28] They have six married children, all of whom work for his businesses. [S29] Friedman resides in Montreal. [S30] He spends one week every month in Israel.
